intro: Melanthium gracile, commonly known as slender false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive reddish tinge. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Melanthium gracile is often found in moist woodland habitats and is known for its ecological value to pollinators.
